ca.ualberta.t14.gametrader

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.t14.gametrader.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AppObservable

    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements AppObservable
    This obsservable class represents the Game Model which stores an inventory item's data: a game. It covers Use Cases 1.1, 4.1, 1.2: Create items that get added to your inventory (1.1) including attaching a photo (4.1) and being able to flag an item as not listed (1.4). Allow users to view their inventory (1.2) Commenting conventions taken from oracle: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/articles/java/index-137868.html

      • getPlatform

        public Game.Platform getPlatform()
        The tag for the game of which platform it runs on. To be used in a View, e.g. to display what platform this game runs on. Returns the platform the game was intended to run on.
        Returns:
        the enumeration of target platform of the game.

      • setPlatform

        public void setPlatform(Game.Platform platform)
        The tag for the game of which platform it runs on. Should be used in a Controller where the user can set the Platform of the item. Set the platform the game was intended to primarily run on.
        Parameters:
        platform - the proper platform enumeration for the game. Use Platform.OTHER if it isn't listed.

        a String containing the title.

        Returns:
        a Boolean if the game is listed/shared or not.

      • setShared

        public void setShared(java.lang.Boolean sharableStatus)
        Set the sharable flag of the game, whether the game will be listed/shared or not. Should be used by a Controller so the user can change the sharable flag.
        Parameters:
        sharableStatus - the Boolean if TRUE then the game will be listed & shared.

      • getPicture

        public Bitmap getPicture()
        Get the picture of the game. To be used in a view so the picture (if any) can be displayed.
        Returns:
        a Bitmap picture of the game.

      • getPictureJson

        public java.lang.String getPictureJson()
        Get the string representation of the bitmap. To be used by the model so this picture can be put in a JSON and put online.
        Returns:
        a string containing the byteArray of the bitmap encoded as a string in Base64.

      • setPictureFromJson

        public java.lang.Boolean setPictureFromJson(java.lang.String jsonBitmap)
        sets the Bitmap of the game object to the json-able image given. To be used by a view when using game items from the network to retrieve the picture (if any) from the JSON format.
        Parameters:
        jsonBitmap - a string containing the byteArray of the bitmap encoded as a string in Base64.
        Returns:
        a Boolean: whether or not the image data could be decoded.

      • setPicture

        public java.lang.Boolean setPicture(Bitmap image)
        Sets a picture for the game. To be used by a Controller so the user can add an image to the game item. If image given is bigger than 200x200 it gets scaled down with longest edge becoming 200, the aspect ratio is kept same. It also compresses the Bitmap to JPG with 85% compression quality so its JSON-able and stores the JSON to the game object.
        Parameters:
        image - a Bitmap picture of the game.
        Returns:
        a Boolean whether the image was set or not. If false, the provided Bitmap is invalid: has a dimension that is 0.

      • addObserver

        public void addObserver(AppObserver observer)
        The Game Model is observable thus anything wanting to obsserve can be added to the watch list.
        Specified by:
        addObserver in interface AppObservable
        Parameters:
        observer - the observer wanting to watch this Model.
